about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: An orange and red triangular sign on a vehicle always means:

about.name: An orange and red triangular sign on a vehicle always means:

hasPart.assesses: An orange and red triangular sign on a vehicle always means: | An orange and red triangular sign on a vehicle always means: - Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Slow-moving vehicles, such as farm tractors, road maintenance vehicles, and animal-drawn carts, display an orange and red triangle on the back.

comment.text: The vehicle has the right-of-way.
Slow-moving vehicle.
Shoulder work ahead.
Slow-moving vehicle.

answerExplanation.text: Slow-moving vehicles, such as farm tractors, road maintenance vehicles, and animal-drawn carts, display an orange and red triangle on the back.

hasPart.name: Fatigue increases the risk of:
hasPart.assesses: Fatigue increases the risk of: | Fatigue increases the risk of: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Fatigue causes errors related to speed and distance, increases your risk of being in a crash, and causes you to take more time to make decisions. When you are fatigued, you could fall asleep behind the wheel and crash, injuring or killing yourself or others.

comment.text: Missing an exit.
Being late for an appointment.

suggestedAnswer.text: Falling asleep behind the wheel and crashing.

comment.text: Falling asleep behind the wheel and crashing.

acceptedAnswer.text: Falling asleep behind the wheel and crashing.

comment.text: Falling asleep behind the wheel and crashing.

answerExplanation.text: Fatigue causes errors related to speed and distance, increases your risk of being in a crash, and causes you to take more time to make decisions. When you are fatigued, you could fall asleep behind the wheel and crash, injuring or killing yourself or others.

comment.text: Fatigue increases the risk of: | Fatigue causes errors related to speed and distance, increases your risk of being in a crash, and causes you to take more time to make decisions. When you are fatigued, you could fall asleep behind the wheel and crash, injuring or killing yourself or others.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: Fatigue increases the risk of: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions

hasPart.name: This sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This sign means: | This sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When approaching this sign, you must yield the right-of-way. Slow down and let vehicles and pedestrians crossing your path pass before you proceed. If necessary, stop before going ahead.

suggestedAnswer.text: Cars on the right move first.

comment.text: Cars on the right move first.
You have the right-of-way.

suggestedAnswer.text: Let cross traffic pass before proceeding.

comment.text: Let cross traffic pass before proceeding.

acceptedAnswer.text: Let cross traffic pass before proceeding.

comment.text: Let cross traffic pass before proceeding.

answerExplanation.text: When approaching this sign, you must yield the right-of-way. Slow down and let vehicles and pedestrians crossing your path pass before you proceed. If necessary, stop before going ahead.

hasPart.name: Which of the following blocks the smooth flow of traffic?

about.name: Which of the following blocks the smooth flow of traffic?

hasPart.assesses: Which of the following blocks the smooth flow of traffic? | Which of the following blocks the smooth flow of traffic? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Rubbernecking (the practice of slowing down to look at collisions or other out-of-the-ordinary things) contributes to traffic congestion and should be avoided.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slowing down to look at collision scene.

comment.text: Slowing down to look at collision scene.
Avoiding unnecessary lane changes.

suggestedAnswer.text: Using public transportation instead of your vehicle.

comment.text: Using public transportation instead of your vehicle.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slowing down to look at collision scene.

comment.text: Slowing down to look at collision scene.

suggestedAnswer.text: Avoid driving in the bicycle lane.

comment.text: Avoid driving in the bicycle lane.

hasPart.name: When driving in work zones, you should:

about.name: When driving in work zones, you should:

hasPart.assesses: When driving in work zones, you should: | When driving in work zones, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When entering and driving through a work zone, slow down and be prepared to stop. Obey posted speed limits and be alert to conditions around you. Workers could be present.

suggestedAnswer.text: Increase your speed to get through the zone as quickly as possible.

comment.text: Increase your speed to get through the zone as quickly as possible.

suggestedAnswer.text: Reduce your speed and be prepared to stop suddenly.

comment.text: Reduce your speed and be prepared to stop suddenly.

suggestedAnswer.text: Maintain your normal speed the whole way through the zone.

comment.text: Maintain your normal speed the whole way through the zone.

acceptedAnswer.text: Reduce your speed and be prepared to stop suddenly.

comment.text: Reduce your speed and be prepared to stop suddenly.

answerExplanation.text: When entering and driving through a work zone, slow down and be prepared to stop. Obey posted speed limits and be alert to conditions around you. Workers could be present.

comment.text: When driving in work zones, you should: | When entering and driving through a work zone, slow down and be prepared to stop. Obey posted speed limits and be alert to conditions around you. Workers could be present.
